summary: Brian Latell is identified as the Director of the Center for the Study of Intelligence. In the context of JFK assassination records, he advised against appealing the JFK Review Board's decision to release the names of two CIA employees who retired under cover. His argument was that the Directorate of Operations' (DO) damage argument would not merit Presidential reversal. The documents suggest his involvement is related to the declassification and review process of JFK assassination records within the CIA.
significance: Brian Latell's significance lies in his role as Director of the Center for the Study of Intelligence, providing advice on the release of CIA information related to the JFK assassination records. His position allowed him to influence decisions regarding declassification and transparency.
